class.name: Node2D
class.brief_description: A 2D game object, parent of all 2D related nodes. Has a position, rotation, scale and Z-index.
class.description: A 2D game object, with a position, rotation and scale. All 2D physics nodes and sprites inherit from Node2D. Use Node2D as a parent node to move, scale and rotate children in a 2D project. Also gives control on the node's render order.

method.name: apply_scale
method.description: Multiplies the current scale by the 'ratio' vector.

method.name: get_angle_to
method.description: Returns the angle between the node and the 'point' in radians.

method.name: get_relative_transform_to_parent
method.description: Returns the [Transform2D] relative to this node's parent.

method.name: global_translate
method.description: Adds the 'offset' vector to the node's global position.

method.name: look_at
method.description: Rotates the node so it points towards the 'point'.

method.name: move_local_x
method.description: Applies a local translation on the node's X axis based on the [method Node._process]'s [code]delta[/code]. If [code]scaled[/code] is false, normalizes the movement.

method.name: move_local_y
method.description: Applies a local translation on the node's Y axis based on the [method Node._process]'s [code]delta[/code]. If [code]scaled[/code] is false, normalizes the movement.

method.name: rotate
method.description: Applies a rotation to the node, in radians, starting from its current rotation.

method.name: to_global
method.description: Converts a local point's coordinates to global coordinates.

method.name: to_local
method.description: Converts a global point's coordinates to local coordinates.

method.name: translate
method.description: Translates the node by the given [code]offset[/code] in local coordinates.

members.member: Position, relative to the node's parent.
Rotation in degrees, relative to the node's parent.
Z-index. Controls the order in which the nodes render. A node with a higher Z-index will display in front of others.
If [code]true[/code] the node's Z-index is relative to its parent's Z-index. If this node's Z-index is 2 and its parent's effective Z-index is 3, then this node's effective Z-index will be 2 + 3 = 5.
